text:
Validate task inserts a spurious "/" at the beginning of the filename when the
-emacs task is used and an error is encountered. This confuses emacs (TRAMP mode
is invoked).


$ ant -emacs validate
Buildfile: build.xml

validate:
/Z:/blah/blah.xml:1294:11: An element with the identifier "oops" must appear in
the document.

BUILD FAILED
Z:\blah\build.xml:160: The following error occurred while executing this line:
Z:\blah\build.xml:188: Z:\blah\blah.xml is not a valid XML document.

Total time: 1 second
creator: a_rankine@yahoo.co.uk
peterreilly@apache.org
text: could you provide the build file and blah.xml files

Created attachment 13660
Testcase files

As requested here are the blah.xml and build.xml files. Also required to
complete the test is the Docbook XML DTD (download from oasis.org). Inside
build.xml, point the docbook.dtd.dir property at the Docbook DTD directory.

Hope this helps. The validation error is not the same as reported in the body
of this bug, but it doesn't matter. The problem is with the formatting of the
filename.
